results.title: Beef background
results.brief_description: Describes the production of fine cattle and quality beef in Australia for domestic and overseas markets. Includes the angus, devon, hereford and santa catrudez breeds. Narrated by Barry Brady.
results.description: Describes the production of fine cattle and quality beef in Australia for domestic and overseas markets. Includes the angus, devon, hereford and santa catrudez breeds. Narrated by Barry Brady.

results.title: Beef and dairy insemination program
results.brief_description: Describes the artificial insemination program at Bacchus Marsh. Outlines methods of collection, selection and storage as well as service to cows.

results.title: Beech foresters
results.brief_description: This film reviews the extent and nature of beech forests in New Zealand and describes schemes undertaken for improvement. Draws attention to the work of the New Zealand Forest Service in carrying out aerial and ground surveys and compiling information, resulting in such schemes as the erection of deer-proof fences, selection of seed trees and the establishment of even age forests. Describes the uses to which timber is put. No other credits available.

results.title: Bedtime stories
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description: Introduces Dorothy Butler who passionately believes books should play a crucial role in children’s lives. Attempts to encourage children to read, by capitalising on their fascination with the television screen. Uses professional storytellers and well-known stories, giving fully annotated details for each book used.

results.title: Bedrooms and hallways [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Rose Troche, Dorothy Berwin, Ceci Dempsey and Berwin and Dempsey Productions
results.brief_description: Rose Troche’s (“Go Fish”) second feature film is a gentle and amusing study into the nuances of sexual preference, dating and masculinity. Using Leo’s (Kevin McKidd) 30th birthday bash as a basis, the film traces Leo’s relationship to the guests; gay room mate Darren (Tom Hollander) and his real estate agent boyfriend (Hugo Weaving) with a penchant for using the bedrooms of the houses he’s selling for their trysts; straight and single friend Angie (Julie Graham); new Age guru and leader of Leo’s men’s group, Keith (Simon Callow); Leo’s previous boyfriend, Brendan (James Purefoy) and Brendan’s current girlfriend, Sally (Jennifer Ehle), who also happens to be Leo’s high school sweetheart. Central to the film are the gatherings of the men’s group for masculine assertiveness and when Leo admits his attraction to seemingly straight, Irishman Brendan, it opens the floodgates for other members of the group with surprising results. (Awards: Winner Audience Award, London Film Festival, 1998)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rose Troche, Dorothy Berwin, Ceci Dempsey and Berwin and Dempsey Productions

results.title: Bedouins of Arabia
results.creator_credit: Richard Taylor and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: Portrays the life of Bedouin tribesmen in the Arabian desert, noting their relationships with each other and with the land. Suitable for upper primary and secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Bedlam  for Spectrum 128 & +2
results.creator_credit: GO! Media Holdings Ltd and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description: Bedlam [computer game]. Bedlam is a top down vertical shooting scroller in a futuristic sci fi setting for one or two players simultaneously. Players pilot a vehicle shooting and dodging aliens and fighting boss ships.
results.creator_credit_for_label: GO! Media Holdings Ltd and Beam Software
